member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Segment
member.summary: A segment is a block of code/data that is loaded in the real memory at runtime. A segment can contain multiple sections in it.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Permission
member.summary: File permission. Each permission corresponds to a bit, and thus, multiple permissions can be OR-ed.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.FileType
member.summary: FileType represents categories for binary files.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.LinkageTableEntry.TableAddress
member.summary: The address of the table that stores the actual target address, e.g., GOT.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.LinkageTableEntry.FuncName
member.summary: Target function name for dynamic linking.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.LinkageTableEntry
member.summary: Linkage table entry object, which basically refers to PLT or IAT.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.Section.ToAddrRange
member.summary: Convert the section into an AddrRange based on its starting address and the size.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Section
member.summary: A section object defined in a file-format-agnostic way. A Section in B2R2 should be located inside a segment.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SectionKind.LinkageTableSection
member.summary: Linkage table, such as PLT, section.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Symbol
member.summary: A symbol object defined in a file-format-agnostic way.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.TargetKind.DynamicSymbol
member.summary: Dynamic symbols cannot be stripped off.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.TargetKind.StaticSymbol
member.summary: Static symbols are used by link editor, and can be stripped off.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.TargetKind
member.summary: Is the symbol used for static target (static link editor) or dynamic target (dynamic linker)?

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.FileType
member.summary: The symbol gives the name of the source file associated with the obj file.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.SectionType
member.summary: The symbol is associated with a section.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.TrampolineType
member.summary: The symbol is associated with a trampoline instruction, such as PLT.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.ExternFunctionType
member.summary: The symbol is associated with an external (imported) function.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.FunctionType
member.summary: The symbol is associated with a general function.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.ObjectType
member.summary: The symbol is associated with a data object, such as a variable.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.SymbolKind.NoType
member.summary: The symbol type is not specified.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.WordSize
member.summary: Word size of the CPU that this binary can run on.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.TextStartAddr
member.summary: The beginning of the text section of this binary.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.IsNXEnabled
member.summary: Is NX enabled for this binary? (DEP enabled or not)

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.ISA
member.summary: The ISA that this file expects to run on.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.FileType
member.summary: What kind of binary is this?

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.FilePath
member.summary: The file path where this file is located.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.FileFormat
member.summary: The format of this file: ELF, PE, Mach-O, or etc.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.EntryPoint
member.summary: The entry point of this binary (the start address that this binary runs at). Note that some binaries (e.g., PE DLL files) do not have a specific entry point, and EntryPoint will return None in such a case.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.TryFindFunctionSymbolName(System.UInt64,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.byref{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.ByRefKinds.InOut})
member.summary: Find the symbol name for a given address.
member.returns: Returns true if a symbol exists, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.TranslateAddress(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Translate a virtual address into a relative offset to this binary.
member.returns: Returns an offset to this binary for a given virtual address.
member.exception: Thrown when the given address is out of a valid address range.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.IsValidRange(B2R2.AddrRange)
member.summary: Check if the given address range is valid. This functino returns true only if the whole range of the addressess are valid (for every address in the range, IsValidAddr should return true).
member.returns: Returns true if the whole range of addresses is within a valid range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.IsValidAddr(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Check if the given address is valid for this binary. We say a given address is valid for the binary if the address is within the range of statically computable segment ranges.
member.returns: Returns true if the address is within a valid range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.IsInFileRange(B2R2.AddrRange)
member.summary: Check if the given address range is valid and there exists a corresponding region in the actual binary file. This functino returns true only if the whole range of the addressess are valid (for every address in the range, IsInFileAddr should return true).
member.returns: Returns true if the whole range of addresses is within a valid range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.IsInFileAddr(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Check if the given address is valid and there is an actual mapping from the binary file to the corresponding memory. Unlike IsValidAddr, this function checks if we can decide the actual value of the given address from the binary. For example, a program header of an ELF file may contain 100 bytes in size, but when it is mapped to a segment in memory, the size of the segment can be larger than the size of the program header. This function checks if the given address is in the range of the segment that has a direct mapping to the file's program header.
member.returns: Returns true if the address is within a mapped address range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSymbols
member.summary: Return a list of all the symbols from the binary.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetStaticSymbols
member.summary: Return a list of all the static symbols from the binary. Static symbols can be removed when we strip the binary. Unlike dynamic symbols, static symbols are not required to run the binary, thus they can be safely removed before releasing it.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSegments(B2R2.BinFile.Permission)
member.summary: For a given permission, return a list of segments that satisfy the permission. For a given "READ-only" permission, this function may return a segment whose permission is "READABLE and WRITABLE", as an instance.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSegments(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Return a list of the segments from the binary, which contain the given address.
member.param: The address that belongs to segments.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSegments(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a list of segments from the binary. If the isLoadable parameter is true, it will only return a list of "loadable" segments. Otherwise, it will return all possible segments. By default, this function returns only loadable segments, e.g., PT_LOAD segment of ELF.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSections(System.String)
member.summary: Return a section that has the specified name.
member.returns: A sequence of sections that have the specified name. This function returns an empty sequence if there is no section of the given name.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSections(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Return a section that contains the given address.
member.param: The address that belongs to a section.
member.returns: A sequence of sections. This function returns a singleton if there exists a corresponding section. Otherwise, it returns an empty sequence.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetSections
member.summary: Return a list of all the sections from the binary.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetRelocationSymbols
member.summary: Return a list of all relocation symbols from the binary.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetNotInFileIntervals(B2R2.AddrRange)
member.summary: Given a range r, return a list of address ragnes (intervals) that are within r, and that are not in-file.
member.returns: Returns an empty list when the given range r is valid, i.e., `IsInFileRange r = true`.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetLinkageTableEntries
member.summary: Return a list of all the linkage table entries from the binary.
member.returns: A sequence of linkage table entries, e.g., PLT entries for ELF files.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetFunctionAddresses
member.summary: Returns a sequence of local function addresses (excluding external functions) from a given FileInfo.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetExecutableSections
member.summary: Get a sequence of executable sections including linkage table code sections such as PLT.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.GetDynamicSymbols(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Return a list of all the dynamic symbols from the binary. Dynamic symbols are the ones that are required to run the binary. The "excludeImported" argument indicates whether to return only internally defined symbols (i.e., disregard external symbols that are imported from other files). In "excludeImported" argument is not given, this function will simply return all possible dynamic symbols.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo.EntryPointToString(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.UInt64})
member.summary: Convert from entrypoint information to string.
member.param: Entry point of a given binary.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.FileInfo
member.summary: FileInfo describes a binary file in a format-agnostic way.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.RawFileInfo
member.summary: This class represents a raw binary file (containing only binary code and data without file format)

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELFFileInfo
member.summary: This class represents an ELF binary file.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.MachFileInfo
member.summary: This class represents a Mach-O binary file.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PEFileInfo
member.summary: This class represents a PE binary file.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.InvalidFileTypeException
member.summary: Raised when an invalid file type is encountered.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.FileFormatMismatchException
member.summary: Raised when an unexpected file format is detected.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.InvalidAddrReadException
member.summary: Raised when accessing an invalid address of a binary file.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FileHelper.trimByRange(B2R2.AddrRange,B2R2.AddrRange)
member.summary: Trim the target range based on my range (myrange) in such a way that the resulting range is always included in myrange.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader.PHAlignment
member.summary: The value to which the segments are aligned in memory and in the file.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader.PHMemSize
member.summary: The number of bytes in the memory image of the segment. This can be greater than PHFileSize as some sections (w/ SHTNoBits type) occupy nothing in the binary file, but can be mapped in the segment at runtime.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader.PHFileSize
member.summary: The number of bytes in the file image of the segment.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader.PHPhyAddr
member.summary: The physical address of the segment. This is reserved for systems using physical addresses.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader.PHAddr
member.summary: The virtual address at which the first byte of the segment resides in memory.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader.PHOffset
member.summary: An offset from the beginning of the file at which the first byte of the segment resides in memory.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeader
member.summary: An executable or shared object file's program header table is an array of structures, each of which describes a segment or the other information a system needs to prepare for execution. An object file segment contains one or more sections. Program headers are meaningful only for executable and shared object files. A file specifies its own program header size with the ELF header's members.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTGNURelro
member.summary: This segment specifies the location and size of a segment which may be made read-only after relocations have been processed.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTGNUStack
member.summary: This segment specifies the permissions on the segment containing the stack and is used to indicate weather the stack should be executable. The absence of this header indicates that the stack will be executable.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTGNUEHFrame
member.summary: This segment specifies the location and size of the exception handling information as defined by the .eh_frame_hdr section.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTHiProc
member.summary: The upper bound of processor-specific program header type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTLoProc
member.summary: The lower bound of processor-specific program header type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTHiOS
member.summary: The upper bound of OS-specific program header type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTLoOS
member.summary: The lower bound of OS-specific program header type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTTLS
member.summary: This segment contains the Thread-Local Storage template.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTPhdr
member.summary: This segment specifies the location and size of the program header table itself, It may occur only if the program header table is part of the memory image of the program. If it is present, it must precede any loadable segment entry.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTShLib
member.summary: This segment type is reserved but has unspecified semantics.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTNote
member.summary: This segment contains the location and size of auxiliary information.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTInterp
member.summary: This segment contains the location and size of a null-terminated path name to invoke an interpreter. This segment type is meaningful only for executable files, but not for shared objects. This segment may not occur more than once in a file. If it is present, it must precede any loadable segment entry.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTDynamic
member.summary: This segment contains dynamic linking information.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType.PTNull
member.summary: This program header is not used.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgramHeaderType
member.summary: This member tells what kind of segment this array element describes or how to interpret the array element's information. A segment is also known as a 'program header'.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSymbolInfo.SecNumToSymbTbls
member.summary: A mapping from a section number to the corresponding symbol table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSymbolInfo.VersionTable
member.summary: Linux-specific symbol version table containing versions required to link.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSymbolInfo
member.summary: Main data structure for storing symbol information.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationEntry.RelSecNumber
member.summary: The number of the section that defines this relocation.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationEntry.RelAddend
member.summary: A constant addend used to compute the value to be stored into the relocatable field.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationEntry.RelSymbol
member.summary: Relocation symbol. Symbol can be None when only the addend is used.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationEntry.RelOffset
member.summary: The location at which to apply the relocation action.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64IRelative
member.summary: x86-64: adjust indirectly by program base.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64Size64
member.summary: x86-64: size of symbol plus 64-bit addend.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64Size32
member.summary: x86-64: size of symbol plus 32-bit addend.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64PLTOFF64
member.summary: x86-64: 64-bit GOT relative offset to PLT entry.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64GOTPLT64
member.summary: x86-64: 64-bit GOT entry offset requiring PLT.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64GOTPC64
member.summary: x86-64: 64-bit PC relative offset to GOT.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64GOTPCREL64
member.summary: x86-64: 64-bit PC-relative offset to GOT entry.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64GOTPC32
member.summary: x86-64: 32-bit signed PC-relative offset to GOT.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX64.RelocX64GOTPCREL
member.summary: x86-64: 32-bit signed PC-relative offset to GOT.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX86.Reloc386GOTPC
member.summary: x86: pc-relative offset to GOT (GOT + A - P).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX86.Reloc386GOTOffset
member.summary: x86: 32-bit offset to GOT (S + A - GOT).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.RelocationX86.Reloc386Relative
member.summary: x86: adjust by program base (S + A).

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSymbol.SecHeaderIndex
member.summary: The index of the relevant section with regard to this symbol.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSymbol.Size
member.summary: Size of the symbol (e.g., size of the data object).

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SecIdx
member.summary: This symbol index holds an index into the section header table.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNHiReserve
member.summary: The upper boundary of the range of the reserved range.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNXIndex
member.summary: An escape value indicating that the actual section header index is too large to fit in the containing field. The header section index is found in another location specific to the structure where it appears.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNCommon
member.summary: The symbol labels a common block that has not yet been allocated.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNABS
member.summary: The symbol has an absolute value that will not change because of relocation.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNHiOS
member.summary: The upper bound of OS-specific section index value.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNLoOS
member.summary: The lower bound of OS-specific section index value.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNHiProc
member.summary: The upper bound of processor-specific section index value.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNLoProc
member.summary: The lower bound of processor-specific section index value.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNUndef
member.summary: The symbol is undefined. Linker should update references to this symbol with the actual definition from another file.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx.SHNLoReserve
member.summary: This is the start of the reserved range.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionHeaderIdx
member.summary: Every symbol table entry is defined in relation to some section. This member holds the relevant section header table index.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolVisibility.STVProtected
member.summary: A symbol defined in the current component is protected if it is visible in other components but cannot be preempted. Any reference to such a symbol from within the defining component must be resolved to the definition in that component, even if there is a definition in another component that would interpose by the default rules.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolVisibility.STVHidden
member.summary: A symbol defined in the current component is hidden if its name is not visible to other components. Such a symbol is necessarily protected. This attribute is used to control the external interface of a component. An object named by such a symbol may still be referenced from another component if its address is passed outside.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolVisibility.STVInternal
member.summary: This visibility attribute is currently reserved.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolVisibility.STVDefault
member.summary: Use the visibility specified by the symbol's binding type (SymbolBind).

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolVisibility
member.summary: This member currently specifies a symbol's visibility

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTHiProc
member.summary: The upper bound of processor-specific symbol type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTLoProc
member.summary: The lower bound of processor-specific symbol type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTHiOS
member.summary: The upper bound of OS-specific binding type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTLoOS
member.summary: The lower bound of OS-specific symbol type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTGNUIFunc
member.summary: A symbol with type STT_GNU_IFUNC is a function, but the symbol does not provide the address of the function as usual. Instead, the symbol provides the address of a function which returns a pointer to the actual function.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTTLS
member.summary: The symbol specifies a Thread-Local Storage entity.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTCommon
member.summary: This symbol labels an uninitialized common block.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTFile
member.summary: This symbol represents the name of the source file associated with the object file.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTSection
member.summary: This symbol is associated with a section. Symbol table entries of this type exist primarily for relocation and normally have STBLocal binding.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTFunc
member.summary: This symbol is associated with a function.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType.STTObject
member.summary: This symbol is associated with a data object, such as variable and an array.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolType
member.summary: A symbol's type provides a general classification for the associated entity.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBHiProc
member.summary: The upper bound of processor-specific binding type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBLoProc
member.summary: The lower bound of processor-specific binding type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBHiOS
member.summary: The upper bound of OS-specific binding type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBLoOS
member.summary: The lower bound of OS-specific binding type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBWeak
member.summary: Weak symbols resemble global symbols, but their definitions have lower precedence.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBGlobal
member.summary: Global symbols are visible to all object files being combined.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind.STBLocal
member.summary: Local symbols are not visible outside. Local symbols of the same name may exist in multiple files without interfering with each other.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SymbolBind
member.summary: A symbol's binding determines the linkage visibility and behavior.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecEntrySize
member.summary: Some sections hold a table of fixed-size entries, such as a symbol table. For such a section, this member gives the size in bytes of each entry.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecAlignment
member.summary: Some sections have address alignment constraints.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecInfo
member.summary: Extra information. The interpretation of this info depends on the section type.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecLink
member.summary: A section header table index link. The interpretation of this field depends on the section type.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecOffset
member.summary: Byte offset from the beginning of the file to the first byte in the section.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecAddr
member.summary: The address at which the section's first byte should reside. If this section will not appear in the process memory, this value is 0.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFSection.SecType
member.summary: Categorizes the section's contents and semantics.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFX8664Large
member.summary: This section can hold more than 2GB.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFExclude
member.summary: This section is excluded from input to the link-edit of an executable or shared object

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFOrdered
member.summary: This section requires ordering in relation to other sections of the same type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFMaskProc
member.summary: All bits included in this mask are reserved for processor-specific semantics.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFMaskOS
member.summary: All bits included in this mask are reserved for operating system-specific semantics.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFGroup
member.summary: This section is a member, perhaps the only one, of a section group.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFOSNonConforming
member.summary: This section requires special OS-specific processing beyond the standard linking rules to avoid incorrect behavior

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFLinkOrder
member.summary: This section adds special ordering requirements to the link editor.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFExecInstr
member.summary: This section contains executable machine code.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFAlloc
member.summary: This section occupies memory during process execution.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag.SHFWrite
member.summary: This section contains data that should be writable during process execution.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionFlag
member.summary: Sections support 1-bit flags that describe miscellaneous attributes.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTGNUVerSym
member.summary: This section holds Linux-specific version information. It specifically contains an array of elements of type Elfxx_Half. It has as many entries as the dynamic symbol table.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTGNUVerNeed
member.summary: This section holds Linux-specific version information (Elfxx_VerNeed). This stores version information of external functions, which is needed by the caller binary.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTGNUVerDef
member.summary: This section holds Linux-specific version information (Elfxx_VerDef). This stores version information of functions defined in the binary.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTHiUser
member.summary: This section specifies the upper bound of program-specific section type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTLoUser
member.summary: This section specifies the lower bound of program-specific section type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTHiProc
member.summary: This section marks the end of processor-specific section type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTLoProc
member.summary: This section marks the start of processor-specific section type.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTGroup
member.summary: This section holds section group information.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTPreInitArray
member.summary: This section contains pre-initialization function pointers.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTFiniArray
member.summary: This section contains termination function pointers.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTInitArray
member.summary: This section contains initialization function pointers.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTDynSym
member.summary: This section contains a minimal set of dynamic linking symbols.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTRel
member.summary: This section holds relocation entries without explicit addends.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTNoBits
member.summary: This section occupies no space, although SecOffset contains a conceptual offset to it.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTDynamic
member.summary: This section holds information for dynamic linking.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTHash
member.summary: This section holds a symbol hash table. All ELF files participating in dynamic linking must contain a symbol hash table.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTRela
member.summary: This section holds relocation entries with explicit addends.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTStrTab
member.summary: This section holds a string table.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTSymTab
member.summary: This section holds a symbol table.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType.SHTProgBits
member.summary: This section holds information defined by the program, whose format and meaning are determined solely by the program.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.SectionType
member.summary: This member categorizes the section's contents and semantics.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.Header.isELF(B2R2.BinReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check if the file has a valid ELF header.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.Section.parseSectionNameContents(B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFHeader,B2R2.BinReader)
member.summary: Return the raw memory contents that represent the section names separated by null character.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ProgHeader.parse(B2R2.BinFile.ELF.ELFHeader,B2R2.BinReader)
member.summary: Parse and associate program headers with section headers to return the list of segments.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSymbol.SymDesc
member.summary: Providing additional information about the nature of this symbol for non-stab symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSymbol.SecNum
member.summary: The number of the section that this symbol can be found.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymbolType.NLeng
member.summary: Second stab entry with length information.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymbolType.NOpt
member.summary: Emitted with gcc2_compiled and in gcc source.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymbolType.NIndirect
member.summary: The symbol is defined to be the same as another symbol.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymbolType.NPreBnd
member.summary: The symbol is undefined and the image is using a prebound value for the symbol.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymbolType.NSect
member.summary: The symbol is defined in the section number given in n_sect.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymbolType.NAbs
member.summary: The symbol is absolute. The linker does not update the value of an absolute symbol.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSection.SecNumOfReloc
member.summary: The number of relocation entries located at SecRelOff for this section.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSection.SecRelOff
member.summary: The file offset of the first relocation entry for this section.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSection.SecOffset
member.summary: The offset to this section in the file.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSection.SecAddr
member.summary: The virtual memory address of this section.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSection.SegName
member.summary: The name of the segment that should eventually contain this section.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionAttribute.AttrSelfModifyingCode
member.summary: Used with i386 code stubs written on by dyld.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionAttribute.AttrLiveSupport
member.summary: Blocks are live if they reference live blocks.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionAttribute.AttrStripStaticSyms
member.summary: OK to strip static symbols in this section in files with the MH_DYLDLINK flag.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionAttribute.AttrNoTOC
member.summary: Section contains coalesced symbols that are not to be in a ranlib table of contents.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionAttribute.AttrPureInstructions
member.summary: Section contains only true machine instructions.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.ThreadLocalInitFunctionPointers
member.summary: Functions to call to initialize TLV values .

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.ThreadLocalZeroFill
member.summary: Template of initial values for TLVs.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.ThreadLocalRegular
member.summary: Template of initial values for TLVs.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.LazyDyLibSymbolPointers
member.summary: Section with only lazy symbol pointers to lazy loaded dylibs.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.Interposing
member.summary: Section with only pairs of function pointers for interposing.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.GBZeroFill
member.summary: Zero fill on demand section (this can be larger than 4 gigabytes).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.Coalesced
member.summary: Section contains symbols that are to be coalesced.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.ModTermFuncPointers
member.summary: Section with only function pointers for termination.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.ModInitFuncPointers
member.summary: Section with only function pointers for initialization.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.SymbolStubs
member.summary: Section with only symbol stubs, byte size of stub in the reserved2 field.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.LazySymbolPointers
member.summary: Section with only lazy symbol pointers.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.NonLazySymbolPointers
member.summary: Section with only non-lazy symbol pointers .

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.LiteralPointers
member.summary: section with only pointers to literals.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionType.CStringLiterals
member.summary: Section with only literal C strings.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.UnhandledCommand
member.summary: This type represents a load command unhandled by B2R2.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DyLibCmd
member.summary: Dynamic library command: the data used by the dynamic linker to match a shared library against the files that have linked to it.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MainCmd.StackSize
member.summary: Initial stack size, if not zero.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DyLdInfoCmd.LazyBindSize
member.summary: The size of lazy binding info.

member.summary: File offset to lazy binding info.

member.summary: The size of weak binding info.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DyLdInfoCmd.WeakBindOff
member.summary: File offset to weak binding info.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumLocalRel
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the local relocation table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.LocalRelOff
member.summary: An integer indicating the byte offset from the start of the file to the local relocation table data.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumExtRel
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the external relocation table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.ExtRelOff
member.summary: An integer indicating the byte offset from the start of the file to the external relocation table data.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumIndirectSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the indirect symbol table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.IndirectSymOff
member.summary: An integer indicating the byte offset from the start of the file to the indirect symbol table data.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumExtRefSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the external reference table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.ExtRefSymOff
member.summary: An integer indicating the byte offset from the start of the file to the external reference table data.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumModTab
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the module table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.ModTabOff
member.summary: An integer indicating the byte offset from the start of the file to the module table data.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumTOCContents
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the table of contents.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.TOCOffset
member.summary: An integer indicating the byte offset from the start of the file to the table of contents data.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumUndefSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the total number of symbols in the group of undefined external symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.IdxUndefSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the index of the first symbol in the group of undefined external symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumExtSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the total number of symbols in the group of defined external symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.IdxExtSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the index of the first symbol in the group of defined external symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.NumLocalSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the total number of symbols in the group of local symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd.IdxLocalSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the index of the first symbol in the group of local symbols.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymTabCmd.StrSize
member.summary: An integer indicating the size (in bytes) of the string table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymTabCmd.StrOff
member.summary: An integer containing the byte offset from the start of the image to the location of the string table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymTabCmd.NumOfSym
member.summary: An integer indicating the number of entries in the symbol table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SymTabCmd.SymOff
member.summary: An integer containing the byte offset from the start of the file to the location of the symbol table entries.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.SegFlag
member.summary: A set of flags that affect the loading of this segment.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.NumSecs
member.summary: The number of section data structures following this load command.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.InitProt
member.summary: The initial virtual memory protections of this segment.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.MaxProt
member.summary: The maximum permitted virtual memory protections of this segment

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.FileSize
member.summary: The number of bytes occupied by this segment on disk

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.FileOff
member.summary: The offset in this file of the data to be mapped at VMAddr.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.VMSize
member.summary: The number of bytes of virtual memory occupied by this segment.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.VMAddr
member.summary: The starting virtual memory address of this segment

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SegCmd.SecOff
member.summary: The offset of the sections in the segment. If the segment has sections then the section structures directly follow the segment command and their size is in the size of the command.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCommand
member.summary: The load command structures are located directly after the header of the object file, and they specify both the logical structure of the file and the layout of the file in virtual memory.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCVerMinWatchOS
member.summary: Build for Watch min OS version

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCDyLibCodeSigDRS
member.summary: Code signing DRs copied from linked dylibs.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCSourceVer
member.summary: Source version used to build binary.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCDyLDEnv
member.summary: String for dyld to treat like environment variable.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCFunStarts
member.summary: Compressed table of function start addresses.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCVerMinIphoneOS
member.summary: Build for iPhoneOS min OS version.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCVerMinMacOSX
member.summary: Build for MacOSX min OS version.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCLazyLoadDyLib
member.summary: Delay load of dylib until first use.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCSegSplitInfo
member.summary: Local of info to split segments

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCSegment64
member.summary: 64-bit segment of this file to be mapped.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCLoadWeakDyLib
member.summary: Load a dynamically linked shared library that is allowed to be missing.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCPreboundDyLib
member.summary: Modules prebound for a dynamically linked shared library.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCIDDyLib
member.summary: This command Specifies the install name of a dynamic shared library.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCLoadDyLib
member.summary: Load a dynamically linked shared library.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCLoadFVMLib
member.summary: Load a specified fixed VM shared library.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCUnixThread
member.summary: This command defines the initial thread state of the main thread of the process.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCThread
member.summary: This command defines the initial thread state of the main thread of the process. LCThread is similar to LCUnixThread but does not cause the kernel to allocate a stack.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCSymTab
member.summary: The symbol table for this file.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.LoadCmdType.LCSegment
member.summary: Defines a segment of this file to be mapped into the address space of the process that loads this file. It also includes all the sections contained by the segment.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachHeader.Flags
member.summary: A set of bit flags indicating the state of certain optional features of the Mach-O file format.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachHeader.SizeOfCmds
member.summary: The number of bytes occupied by the load commands following the header structure.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHAppExtensionSafe
member.summary: The code was linked for use in an application extension.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHNoHeapExecution
member.summary: When this bit is set, the OS will run the main executable with a non-executable heap even on platforms (e.g. i386) that don't require it. Only used in MHExecute filetypes.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHHasTLVDescriptors
member.summary: Contains a section of type ThreadLocalVariables.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHDeadStrippableDYLIB
member.summary: Only for use on dylibs. When linking against a dylib that has this bit set, the static linker will automatically not create a LCLoadDyLib load command to the dylib if no symbols are being referenced from the dylib.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHPIE
member.summary: When this bit is set, the OS will load the main executable at a random address.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHNoReexportedDylibs
member.summary: When this bit is set on a dylib, the static linker does not need to examine dependent dylibs to see if any are re-exported.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHSetUIDSafe
member.summary: When this bit is set, the binary declares it is safe for use in processes when issetugid() is true.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHRootSafe
member.summary: When this bit is set, the binary declares it is safe for use in processes with uid zero.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHAllowStackExecution
member.summary: When this bit is set, all stacks in the task will be given stack execution privilege. Only used in MHExecute filetypes.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHBindsToWeak
member.summary: The final linked image uses weak symbols.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHWeakDefines
member.summary: The final linked image contains external weak symbols.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHCanonical
member.summary: The binary has been canonicalized via the unprebind operation.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHSubsectionsViaSymbols
member.summary: Safe to divide up the sections into sub-sections via symbols for dead code stripping.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHAllModsBound
member.summary: Indicates that this binary binds to all two-level namespace modules of its dependent libraries. only used when MH_PREBINDABLE and MH_TWOLEVEL are both set.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHPrebindable
member.summary: the binary is not prebound but can have its prebinding redone. only used when MHPreBound is not set.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHNoFixPrebinding
member.summary: Do not have dyld notify the prebinding agent about this executable.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHNoMultiDefs
member.summary: This umbrella guarantees no multiple defintions of symbols in its sub-images so the two-level namespace hints can always be used.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHForceFlat
member.summary: The executable is forcing all images to use flat name space bindings.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHTwoLevel
member.summary: The image is using two-level name space bindings.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHLazyInit
member.summary: the shared library init routine is to be run lazily via catching memory faults to its writeable segments (obsolete).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHSplitSegs
member.summary: The file has its read-only and read-write segments split.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHPreBound
member.summary: The file has its dynamic undefined references prebound.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHBinDatLoad
member.summary: The object file's undefined references are bound by the dynamic linker when loaded.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHDYLDLink
member.summary: The object file is input for the dynamic linker and can't be statically link edited again.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHIncrLink
member.summary: The object file is the output of an incremental link against a base file and can't be linked against a base file and can't be link edited again.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFlag.MHNoUndefs
member.summary: The object file has no undefined references.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFileType.MHDsym
member.summary: Companion file with only debug sections.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachFileType.MHDylibStub
member.summary: Shared library stub for static linking only, no section contents.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.CPUSubType
member.summary: CPUSubType specifies the exact model of the CPU.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Magic.FATCigam
member.summary: The file is intended for use on multiple architectures (FAT binary). This value is used on a little-endian host.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Magic.FATMagic
member.summary: The file is intended for use on multiple architectures (FAT binary). This value is used on a big-endian host.

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Magic.MHCigam64
member.summary: The byte ordering scheme of the target machine is the reverse of the host CPU (64-bit CPU).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Magic.MHMagic64
member.summary: The file is intended for use on a CPU with the same endianness as the computer on which the compiler is running (64-bit CPU).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Magic.MHCigam
member.summary: The byte ordering scheme of the target machine is the reverse of the host CPU (32-bit CPU).

member.name: F:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Magic.MHMagic
member.summary: The file is intended for use on a CPU with the same endianness as the computer on which the compiler is running (32-bit CPU).

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Symbol.parseExportTrieHead(B2R2.BinReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: The symbols exported by a dylib are encoded in a trie.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Symbol.parseSymbolPtrs``1(B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachHeader,B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionInfo,``0[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Symbol pointer tables are similar to GOT in ELF.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Symbol.parseSymbolStubs``1(B2R2.BinFile.Mach.SectionInfo,``0[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: __stubs section is similar to PLT in ELF.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Symbol.parseDynSymTable(B2R2.BinReader,Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DySymTabCmd})
member.summary: DynSym table contains indices to the symbol table.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.Mach.Symbol.parseSymTab(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachSymbol},B2R2.BinReader,B2R2.BinFile.Mach.MachHeader,B2R2.BinFile.Mach.DyLibCmd[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Parse SymTab, which is essentially an array of n_list.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.PE.FindSectionIdxFromRVA
member.summary: A function for finding section index for a given rva (int).

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.PE.ForwardMap
member.summary: Exported function name to forwarded function name.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.PESymbol
member.summary: PE symbol. We separate B2R2.BinFile.Symbol from format-specific symbol type for ease of analysis.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ModuleInfo.SymStreamIndex
member.summary: The index of the stream that contains symbol information for this module.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ModuleInfo.SectionIndex
member.summary: The section in the binary which contains the code/data from this module.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.DBIStreamHeader.ModInfoSize
member.summary: Size of the module info substream.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.DBIStreamHeader.SymRecordStreamIdx
member.summary: The index to the stream containing all CodeView symbol records used by the program.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.DBIStreamHeader.PublicStreamIdx
member.summary: The index to the public stream.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.DBIStreamHeader.GlobalStreamIdx
member.summary: The index to the global stream.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.StreamDirectory
member.summary: The Stream Directory contains information about the other streams in an MSF file. MSF is a file system internally used in a PDB file, and a file in MSF is often called as a stream.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.SuperBlock.BlockMapAddr
member.summary: The index of a block within the MSF file.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.SuperBlock.NumDirectoryBytes
member.summary: The size of the stream directory, in bytes. The stream directory contains information about each stream's size and the set of blocks that it occupies.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.SuperBlock.NumBlocks
member.summary: The total number of blocks in the file.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.SuperBlock.FreeBlockMapIdx
member.summary: The index of a block within the file, at which begins a bit field representing the set of all blocks within the file, which are free.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.SuperBlock.BlockSize
member.summary: The block size of the internal file system. PDB can be considered as a file system within the file.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.SuperBlock
member.summary: SuperBlock forms the header of a PDB file.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportAddressTableField.ForwarderRVA
member.summary: The pointer to a null-terminated ASCII string in the export section. This string must be within the range that is given by the export table data directory entry.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportAddressTableField.ExportRVA
member.summary: The address of the exported symbol when loaded into memory, relative to the image base. For example, the address of an exported function.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportAddressTableField
member.summary: Each entry in the export address table is a field that uses one of two formats: ExportRVA and ForwarderRVA.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.OrdinalTableRVA
member.summary: The address of the ordinal table, relative to the image base.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.NamePointerRVA
member.summary: The address of the export name pointer table, relative to the image base. The table size is given by the Number of Name Pointers field.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.ExportAddressTableRVA
member.summary: The address of the export address table, relative to the image base.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.NumNamePointers
member.summary: The number of entries in the name pointer table. This is also the number of entries in the ordinal table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.AddressTableEntries
member.summary: The number of entries in the export address table.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.OrdinalBase
member.summary: The starting ordinal number for exports in this image. This field specifies the starting ordinal number for the export address table. It is usually set to 1.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable.ExportDLLName
member.summary: The name of the DLL to export.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ExportDirectoryTable
member.summary: The export directory table contains address information that is used to resolve imports to the entry points within this image.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ImportDirectoryTable.DelayLoad
member.summary: Indicate whether this IDT is delay IDT or not.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ImportDirectoryTable.ImportAddressTableRVA
member.summary: The RVA of the import address table. The contents of this table are identical to the contents of the import lookup table until the image is bound.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ImportDirectoryTable.ImportDLLName
member.summary: The name of the DLL to import.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ImportDirectoryTable.ForwarderChain
member.summary: The index of the first forwarder reference.

member.name: P:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ImportDirectoryTable.ImportLookupTableRVA
member.summary: The RVA of the import lookup table.

member.name: T:B2R2.BinFile.PE.ImportDirectoryTable
member.summary: The import information begins with the import directory table, which describes the remainder of the import information. This type includes both delay IDT and normal IDT.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.PE.Helper.getVirtualSectionSize(System.Reflection.PortableExecutable.SectionHeader)
member.summary: Some PE files have a section header indicating that the corresponding section's size is zero even if it contains actual data, i.e., sHdr.VirtualSize = 0, but sHdr.SizeOfRawData <> 0. Thus, we should use this function to get the size of sections (segments).

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.PE.Parser.findSectionIndex(System.Reflection.PortableExecutable.SectionHeader[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This is equivalent to GetContainingSectionIndex function except that we are using our own section header array here. This should be used instead of GetContainingSectionIndex as we sometimes consider only a subset of the sections in a file, e.g., when analyzing COFF binaries.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FormatDetector.Detect(System.String)
member.summary: Given a binary file path, identify its file format and return B2R2.FileFormat.

member.name: M:B2R2.BinFile.FormatDetector.Detect(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Given a byte array, identify its file format and return B2R2.FileFormat.
